intro: Baphia longipedicellata subsp. longipedicellata, commonly known as the long-fruited baphia, is a member of the Leguminosae family. It is a shrub characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces elongated, pod-like fruits that are typically hairy and contain several seeds. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
